alert.note: Alert for Forrest; Jasper; Jones; Smith (Mississippi) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 25 at 1:46PM CDT by NWS Jackson
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of southwestern Jasper, northern Forrest, southeastern Smith and Jones Counties through 215 PM CDT... At 146 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from Hebron to near Moselle to near Petal. Movement was northeast at 45 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Strong thunderstorms will be near... Hebron around 150 PM CDT. Laurel and Ellisville around 155 PM CDT. Stringer around 205 PM CDT. Moss around 215 PM CDT. Other locations impacted by these storms include Soso. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. High winds can bring down trees and large limbs resulting in serious injury or property damage. Exercise extreme caution when outdoors during such strong winds...and be especially aware of older trees. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 500 PM CDT for central, southeastern and east central Mississippi.
